articles.headline: A Hedge Fund Bailout Highlights How Regulators Ignored Big Risks
articles.snippet: The Dodd-Frank financial law succeeded at making banks safer, but empowered shadowy corners of finance that nearly wrecked the system in March.
articles.abstract: The Dodd-Frank financial law succeeded at making banks safer, but empowered shadowy corners of finance that nearly wrecked the system in March.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the coronavirus began shuttering the global economy in March, critical parts of U.S. financial markets edged toward collapse. The shock was huge and unexpected, but the vulnerabilities were well known, the legacy of risk-taking outside regulatory reach.
articles.byline: By Jeanna Smialek and Deborah B. Solomon

articles.headline: With Officials’ Backing, Dubious Virus Remedies Surge in Latin America
articles.snippet: A chlorine solution, particularly popular in Bolivia, is just one of several unproven treatments gaining ground in a region desperate for hope.
articles.abstract: A chlorine solution, particularly popular in Bolivia, is just one of several unproven treatments gaining ground in a region desperate for hope.
articles.lead_paragraph: TARIJA, Bolivia — In Cochabamba, high in the Bolivian Andes, people line up daily outside pharmacies on the central plaza, eager to buy the scarce elixir they hope will ward off Covid-19: chlorine dioxide, a kind of bleach used to disinfect swimming pools and floors.
articles.byline: By María Silvia Trigo, Anatoly Kurmanaev and José María León Cabrera

articles.headline: Here’s How Congress Might Replace the Extra $600 Weekly Jobless Benefit
articles.snippet: Supplemental checks for laid-off workers are set to expire at month’s end. Republicans and Democrats disagree on what to do next.
articles.abstract: Supplemental checks for laid-off workers are set to expire at month’s end. Republicans and Democrats disagree on what to do next.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — An additional $600 per week that has provided a vital financial cushion for unemployed Americans has begun to expire. On Monday, top Republicans had reached agreement on a proposal to reduce a benefit that has helped millions of laid-off workers and been a boon to consumer spending amid a deep recession.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Ben Casselman

articles.headline: Rise in Unemployment Claims Signals an Economic Reversal
articles.snippet: Job losses showed no letup as a surge in coronavirus cases forced new business shutdowns and a $600 weekly federal benefit inched to its expiration.
articles.abstract: Job losses showed no letup as a surge in coronavirus cases forced new business shutdowns and a $600 weekly federal benefit inched to its expiration.
articles.lead_paragraph: New state unemployment claims increased last week for the first time in nearly four months, disturbing evidence that the struggling economy is backsliding at a time when coronavirus cases are on the rise.

articles.headline: Trump Abruptly Cancels Republican Convention in Florida: ‘It’s Not the Right Time’
articles.snippet: After forcing the convention to move from Charlotte to Jacksonville because he wanted a big celebration, President Trump called off the Florida portion, citing the health risks from the coronavirus.
articles.abstract: After forcing the convention to move from Charlotte to Jacksonville because he wanted a big celebration, President Trump called off the Florida portion, citing the health risks from the coronavirus.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bowing to threats posed by the coronavirus, President Trump reversed course on Thursday and canceled the portion of the Republican National Convention to be held in Jacksonville, Fla., just weeks after he moved the event from North Carolina because state officials wanted the party to take health precautions there.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Patricia Mazzei and Annie Karni

articles.headline: A Rare Look Inside Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Draws Legal Threats
articles.snippet: A new documentary peers inside the secretive world of immigration enforcement. The filmmakers faced demands to delete scenes and delay broadcast until after the election.
articles.abstract: A new documentary peers inside the secretive world of immigration enforcement. The filmmakers faced demands to delete scenes and delay broadcast until after the election.
articles.lead_paragraph: In early 2017, as Immigration and Customs Enforcement prepared to carry out the hard-line agenda on which President Trump had campaigned, agency leaders jumped at the chance to let two filmmakers give a behind-the-scenes look at the process.

articles.headline: A.O.C. Unleashes a Viral Condemnation of Sexism in Congress
articles.snippet: After a Republican lawmaker referred to Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez using a sexist vulgarity, she took to the House floor to denounce the abuse faced by women in Congress and across the nation.
articles.abstract: After a Republican lawmaker referred to Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez using a sexist vulgarity, she took to the House floor to denounce the abuse faced by women in Congress and across the nation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Ever since Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez came to Congress as the youngest woman elected to the House, she has upended traditions, harnessing the power of social media and challenging leaders, including President Trump, who are 50 years her senior.
articles.byline: By Luke Broadwater and Catie Edmondson

articles.headline: A Russian Gas Pipeline Increases Tension Between the U.S. and Europe
articles.snippet: The Nord Stream 2 Russia-to-Germany pipeline is 94 percent complete. Washington wants to keep it that way.
articles.abstract: The Nord Stream 2 Russia-to-Germany pipeline is 94 percent complete. Washington wants to keep it that way.
articles.lead_paragraph: A hulking Russian pipe-laying vessel called the Akademik Cherskiy can be seen off Germany’s Baltic coast these days, marine tracking sites say, apparently waiting for the chance to complete the final stretches of a massive undersea pipeline that will carry natural gas directly to Germany from Russia.
articles.byline: By Stanley Reed and Lara Jakes

articles.headline: How One of America’s Whitest Cities Became the Center of B.L.M. Protests
articles.snippet: In a state with a brutal racist history, the Black Lives Matter protests in Portland, Ore., have been overwhelmingly attended by white demonstrators.
articles.abstract: In a state with a brutal racist history, the Black Lives Matter protests in Portland, Ore., have been overwhelmingly attended by white demonstrators.
articles.lead_paragraph: PORTLAND, Ore. — Seyi Fasoranti, a chemist who moved to Oregon from the East Coast six months ago, has watched the Black Lives Matter protests in Portland with fascination. A sea of white faces in one of the whitest major American cities has cried out for racial justice every night for nearly two months.

articles.headline: Big Tech Funds a Think Tank Pushing for Fewer Rules. For Big Tech.
articles.snippet: Google, Amazon and Qualcomm finance a George Mason University institute teaching a hands-off approach to antitrust regulators and judges.
articles.abstract: Google, Amazon and Qualcomm finance a George Mason University institute teaching a hands-off approach to antitrust regulators and judges.
articles.lead_paragraph: HUNTINGTON BEACH, Calif. — A year ago, antitrust officials from Australia, Brazil, China, Japan and eight other countries enjoyed $110-a-plate steak dinners and unlimited pours from $70 bottles of wine at a beachfront hotel surrounded by panoramic views of the sun setting over the Pacific Ocean.

articles.headline: Goldman Sachs and Malaysia Reach $3.9 Billion Settlement in 1MDB Scandal
articles.snippet: The deal settles charges in Malaysia against the Wall Street bank for its role in helping to raise hundreds of millions for a sovereign wealth fund that was used as a personal piggy bank.
articles.abstract: The deal settles charges in Malaysia against the Wall Street bank for its role in helping to raise hundreds of millions for a sovereign wealth fund that was used as a personal piggy bank.
articles.lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs has agreed to a $3.9 billion settlement with Malaysia as it begins to put behind it a kleptocracy scandal that changed the course of politics in the country.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Stevenson and Matthew Goldstein
